6. It can survive on clothing 6-12 hours; laundry detergent will kill it.7. Drinking warm water is effective for all viruses. Try not to drink liquids with ice.8. Wash your hands frequently as the virus can only live on your hands for 5-10 minutes. Do not rub your eyes or nose

4. If someone sneezes with it, it takes about 10 feet before it drops to the ground and is no longer airborne.5. If it drops on a metal surface it will live for at least 12 hours. If you come into contact with any metal surface - wash your hands with a bacterial soap.

THE SYMPTOMS1. It will first infect the throat, so you'll have a sore throat lasting 3/4 days.2. The virus then blends into a nasal fluid that enters the trachea and then the lungs, causing pneumonia. This takes about 5/6 days further.

1. If you have a runny nose and sputum, itâ€™s a common cold.2. Coronavirus pneumonia is a dry cough with no runny nose.3. This virus is not heat-resistant & will be killed by a temperature of just 26/27 degrees. It hates the Sun.
